brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is evaluate the effect of timing and magnitude on the administration of our nonpharmaceutical treatment to motion sickness, and to evaluate the effect of GVR amplitude on functional fitness task performance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the rotation of the chair, approximately 1 hr
primary_outcome.description: Motion Perception verbal report using a visual analog scale (1-100) will be recorded during the rotation of the chair (1=feeling no motion perception; 100=feeling the maximum motion perception)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the rotation of the chair, approximately 1 hr
secondary_outcome.description: subjective experiences of motion sickness in a scale of 0-10 (0=not at all; 10=most severe)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Galvanic Vestibular Stimulation during the entire session
arm_group.description: Subjects will be given galvanic vestibular stimulation (GVS), which applies low electrical currents to the vestibular system, during the entire session.
Subjects will be not be given galvanic vestibular stimulation (GVS) during the entire session.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Galvanic Vestibular Stimulation starting from mid-session
arm_group.description: Subjects will be given galvanic vestibular stimulation (GVS), which applies low electrical currents to the vestibular system, starting from mid-session.

intervention.description: Low electrical currents to the vestibular system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be able to consent to participate themselves.
- Must be 21 to 55 years of age.
- Must be able to attend in-person sessions at the Mayo Aerospace Medicine and - - ------
- Vestibular Research Laboratory in Scottsdale, AZ.
- No racial ethnic groups will be excluded.
- Must be fluent speakers of English.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of vestibular disease, migraine, or significant balance disorder.
- Traumatic brain injury.
- Recent middle ear infection or recent motion sickness (within 72 hours).
- History of severe motion sensitivity.
- Women who are pregnant.
